verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329>, A Psalm of David <WH1732>. The fool <WH5036> hath said <WH559> in his heart <WH3820>, There is no God <WH430>. They are corrupt <WH7843>, they have done abominable <WH8581> works <WH5949>, there is none that doeth <WH6213> good <WH2896>.

The LORD <WH3068> looked down <WH8259> from heaven <WH8064> upon the children <WH1121> of men <WH120>, to see <WH7200> if there <WH3426> were any that did understand <WH7919>, and seek <WH1875> God <WH430>.
They are all gone aside <WH5493>, they are all together <WH3162> become filthy <WH444>: there is none that doeth <WH6213> good <WH2896>, no, not one <WH259>.
Have all the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> no knowledge <WH3045>? who eat up <WH398> my people <WH5971> as they eat <WH398> bread <WH3899>, and call <WH7121> not upon the LORD <WH3068>.
There were they in great <WH6343> fear <WH6342>: for God <WH430> is in the generation <WH1755> of the righteous <WH6662>.
Ye have shamed <WH954> the counsel <WH6098> of the poor <WH6041>, because the LORD <WH3068> is his refuge <WH4268>.

Oh that <WH5414> the salvation <WH3444> of Israel <WH3478> were come out of Zion <WH6726>! when the LORD <WH3068> bringeth back <WH7725> the captivity <WH7622> of his people <WH5971>, Jacob <WH3290> shall rejoice <WH1523>, and Israel <WH3478> shall be glad <WH8055>.
